Package com.android

Class Animal

java.lang.Object
com.android.Animal
public final class Animal
extends Object
CREATING IMMUTABLE OBJECTS create objects that can be shared across mutiple classes but do not want they're values modified. copies of objects creates large overheads 1>>>use a constructor to set ALL of the properites of the object 2>>>Mark all of the instance variables to be private and final 3>>>don't define any setter methods 4>>>don't allow referenced mutable objects to modified or accessed directly 5>>>Prevent methods from being overridden To see video tutorial for this section of code Video tutorial For all 177 videos, which cover all the topics in this course go to Complete Course Video Tutorial

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int age
    age of the animal which we mark as final to prevent the variables value being changed
    private Employee emp1
    we can't change who the emp1 is, it will always be the object first assigned to it, however we can change the "weight" and the "id" of this object.
    private List<String> favouriteFoods
    list of favourite foods for each animal which we also mark as final when you mark an list as final you are only saying that the List itself is final however the objects the list contains are not in themself final.
    private String name
    when you mark a class as final, you can't extends the class, which means you can't override the methods of the class.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Animal​(String name, int age, Employee emp1, List<String> favouriteFoods)
    constructor for the animal class

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int getAge()
    Primitives are not passed by reference so you can return this without it being modified
    Employee getEmp1()
    this sends a copy of the Employee object, not the orginal object so if you change the name of this Employee it will not affect emp1 this is a shallow copy
    List<String> getFavouriteFoods()
    if you have a list and it's in a immutable, you don't return the list you return THE VALUES of the list (shallow copy)
    String getName()
    String class is immutable itself so you can return this without it being modified
    String toString()
    toString method of the Animal class which will print out the details of the Animal

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • name

      private final String name
      when you mark a class as final, you can't extends the class, which means you can't override the methods of the class. A final class DOES NOT prevent you from changing the variables of the class, marking a variable as final means you cannot change the value of the variable.

    • age

      private final int age
      age of the animal which we mark as final to prevent the variables value being changed

    • emp1

      private final Employee emp1
      we can't change who the emp1 is, it will always be the object first assigned to it, however we can change the "weight" and the "id" of this object. we wish to ensure that the "weight" and "id" CANNOT be changed, so the getter for this variable will send a COPY of the object and not the orignal object

    • favouriteFoods

      private final List<String> favouriteFoods
      list of favourite foods for each animal which we also mark as final when you mark an list as final you are only saying that the List itself is final however the objects the list contains are not in themself final. so when we use a getter to view these objects in the list, ensure that you are sending a COPY of the objects and not the original list

  • Constructor Details

    • Animal

      Animal​(String name, int age, Employee emp1, List<String> favouriteFoods)
      constructor for the animal class

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      String class is immutable itself so you can return this without it being modified

    • getAge

      public int getAge()
      Primitives are not passed by reference so you can return this without it being modified

    • getEmp1

      public Employee getEmp1()
      this sends a copy of the Employee object, not the orginal object so if you change the name of this Employee it will not affect emp1 this is a shallow copy

    • getFavouriteFoods

      public List<String> getFavouriteFoods()
      if you have a list and it's in a immutable, you don't return the list you return THE VALUES of the list (shallow copy)

    • toString

      public String toString()
      toString method of the Animal class which will print out the details of the Animal
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
